ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Up-to-date version of make_report.pl ? [1 Attachment]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Noah, We ve been working on updating the Perl script and still miss one thing: how does Heritrix compile the bytes size? Does it use any filter? Bytes

Hello Noah,

We've been working on updating the Perl script and still miss =
one thing:
how does Heritrix compile the bytes size? Does it use any filter=
?
Bytes count is slightly different in reports produced by the Perl script =

and Heritrix.

For instance:
* Total Raw Data Size in Bytes in a crawl-rep=
ort.txt
produced by the Perl script is: 69707545789 (64.92 GB)
produced by =
Heritrix is: 70005021208 (65 GB)

* bytes count a hosts-report.txt
produced=
 by the Perl script is: 999 21087897 www.apci.asso.fr 0 0
produced by Herit=
rix is: 999 21429018 www.apci.asso.fr 0 0

* bytes count a mimetype-report.=
txt
produced by the Perl script is: 114255 902098368 image/gif
produced by =
Heritrix is: 114255 933750505 image/gif

But it can also be more in the cou=
nt produced by the Perl script:
* Total Raw Data Size in Bytes in another c=
rawl-report.txt
produced by the Perl script is: Total Raw Data Size in Byte=
s: 10980717146 
(10.23 GB)
produced by Heritrix is: Total Raw Data Size in =
Bytes: 11080309933 (10 GB)

Thanks for your help!

Sara

[Attachment(s) from Noah Levitt included below]
Hello Sara=
,

I'm attaching another version of make_reports.pl. This is the one we use=
 
to clean up interrupted crawls for archive-it.org. (I didn't know about 
=
the one in the heritrix source tree until I saw this thread.)

I don't thin=
k this version will solve your problems, but maybe it will 
have something =
useful to you. For one thing it does create the [#robots] 
and [#remaining]=
 columns in hosts-report.txt.

For our purposes, we don't need the output o=
f the script to match heritrix 
exactly. Your best bet might be to debug an=
d edit the script yourself, 
which I don't imagine should be too difficult.=


Noah
